text: Had a vehicle towed from my house to Integrity cause of it not running . This car didn't have much problems only needed parts put on that I already had that I stored in car . My car sat in there parking lot for 2 weeks and was not touched by them . I did call them 3 times asking for any updates and was told by them  it would be done on a Monday . I waited till Friday of same week and got fed up on waiting . I had another shop come with there towing truck . I would not recommend  Integrity ! They are also rude as I was only wanting updates.  They told me if I could do it faster then come get it so I did .

text: They lie and delay.  Don't take your vehicle there if you expect to use it for several months .  Mine sat there so long that mice made a nest in the wiring harness.

name: alice gaylor
text:
I am purchasing a new (used) vehicle that is in need of some repairs and Integrity is where the car lot took it to be serviced. I stopped by today (my first time ever being there) to check on the progress and was VERY impressed. Although my car isn't ready, Ryan and a couple of other employees were SO helpful and informative about everything going on with it. I never felt rushed or like I was being a burden for stopping by. As a matter of fact, they were trying to get the air in my truck going for me so I would have AC until my car gets fixed!! Unfortunately it wasn't able to be fixed but just the kindness and courtesy these guys showed was refreshing!!! I will definitely be using them for my go to shop from now on!!

****Updated Review****

HUGE shout out to the employees at Integrity!!! All the way from Robert, to Liz, Brian, and Doug.....you guys absolutely rock!!!!! Not only have you guys fixed the original car issues, but you helped me get the other things taken car of as well. I was greeted with a smile and excellent customer service EVERY time I stopped in and have nothing but praise for you guys!! Thanks so much for everything!!!

text: I had my car taken up here to get the Rack and Pinion and 2 rims fixed. They did all this unnecessary work like fix my bumper that wasnt broken and repainted my car for no reason. I have had this car in there for about a month now and I finally get a call from my insurance, NOT THE COMPANY MY CAR IS WITH, telling me that my car was totaled. And now I have no car in order to do my job in anymore. I highly would not recommend this place for any sort of repairs or fixing of your vehicles.

name: Mark Lanier
text: 5 star service. They will have all my vehicle maintenance work from here on out. I had my truck towed to them they had the problem diagnosed and fixed by the next afternoon. They called and let me know what was going on and what it would take to fix before doing anything. They took all my warranty so my cost was just the deductible from my warranty. Great people and customer service.

name: Josh Mckleroy
text: Had transmission rebuilt in September of 2019 had to take it back 2 days later because it was leaking fluid where the transmission bolts to the transfer case. Then around Christmas I realized the 4 wheel drive didn't work called up there and was told someone would call me back and they never did and done this multiple times for the next year and in November 2020 the transmission has went completely out after 14 months and 16000 miles owner blocked me on social media because he knows he has done wrong and hopefully by sharing my experience I can save someone the hassle and money so they don't waste $1800 like it did

name: P M
text: Not sure why the rating for this business is so high. As a mechanic I can say that I have seen some terrible work come from this shop, and I have seen some very upset customers who have lost thousands of dollars by trusting these guys. I’m making this post because today I ran across a third car they “worked on” and for the third time the repair they performed was unnecessary, and did not fix the issue. And for the second time, the work they did actually caused additional issues.

name: Karen Patterson
text: Super place too have work done on your car! Friendly, helpful staff and the work performed  is always priced reasonably and completed in a good time frame. I only have 1 vehicle so I can't wait several days or more for my car to be repaired. I've used Integrity for a couple of years now and am always satisfied with the quality of the work performed and the cost for same.

name: Chris Holmes
text: This morning I dropped off my car at 9 by 1030 they had my oil changed and air fixed.  I was a walk in and was blown away by their customer service.  There was no profanity or nasty jokes that you typically hear at a shop. They truly live up to their name. They also fixed my blinker for free. Hands down best place to work on your vehicle. I want be going anywhere else from now on. Highly recommend

name: Anthony Durante
text: They do a real  good job!

name: Beth Condit
text: The people were very nice but we were charged over $1000 and we still had the issue when we picked the truck up. When we went back in they told us it was something else and would cost over $400 to get that repair done. They misdiagnosed the issue and wanted us to pay for another costly repair. I will not be using them again. They also did not disclose there is a 4% charge for using a credit card until after the repair was done.

resp.text:
Not true at all. Your truck needed a new rack , alignment and brakes was gone on the front. I talk to your husband and told him after we fix the know problems we found you also needed a clock spring. And as far as the charge on the credit card company I also talk to your husband about that. Their are signs in the service department hanging and on back of the computes about credit card company.
I'm sorry you feel the way you do. We could have fixed the clock spring but also talked to your husband about that.
My name is Robert I'm the owner of the shop I'm asking you to give me a call about this 2567354000
We can only fix what the customers allow us to fix.
Good thing is still have front rotors and pads that was on truck and the rack also so your more than welcome to come see them.

name: Amber Jones
text: We used them one time to get a radiator hose replaced. They told us they would also do a full inspection and call us to let us know if there was or wasn't anything else found. Never heard from anyone. Figured maybe they got busy and we just let it go. Just last week we figured let's give them another shot because the service was great last time.... My husband called to find out how much brakes and rotors would cost us and they told him they would call him back with that info.... We never heard from them. Customer service isn't the greatest. Friendly service in person. Just don't expect a call back.

resp.text:
I'm sorry for not getting a call back. We are down 2 people in service department.  Can't find help. I know that is no excuse but I hope you come back and give us another chance.
If you have any other problems please call me Robert Taylor 256 735 6808 my personal cell

text: I went to integrity auto on yesterday because I was scared. I’m a single mom trying to provide for her family. This vehicle is my lifeline to work, food, church and pleasure. My engine light came on 11 days ago. I called them and the guy got me in there Immediately, took care of me ASAP, fixed the problem and sent me on my way. Christian based facility.... you guys and gals are God SENT!!! You rock.🤩🤩 I love me sum Integrity Automotive!!!

text: Our van broke down In Cullman while traveling from Huntsville to Birmingham. We were lucky to stumble upon Integrity. Thank you for going above and beyond!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words

name: danielle johnson
text: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!! Highly satisfied with my visit. As a woman, most shops will try to take advantage but not this place. Everyone, from the mechanics to the customer service desk, was so kind. The mechanics took the time to explain what needed to be done to fix my car and even showed me what was wrong. I really appreciated that. I had to stay at the shop while they fixed my car, they knew I needed to get home by a certain time and they made sure to get me back on the road in that time frame. I will never go anywhere else. My encounter with everyone who works there definitely lived up to the business name. Thank you Integrity!!

text: So thankful to find a trustworthy place for vehicle repairs.  Nicest people you could ever deal with. Quality work.  Will surely use for all repairs.

text: My car died on the interstate. I called them and they had it towed to the shop. Timing belt broke. They are going to replace the engine which is going to be expensive but they are working with me on that. Everyone I've talked to had treated me with respect and have been very pleasant. I'll update this review when I get my car back.

name: Kelsie West
text: My husband took his truck here explaining the problem to begin with, when it was dropped off. $3,400 dollars later and over at the least one month later and that problem was never fixed (was not told that until pickup today) along with after picking it up smoke came from the tail pipe and the air conditioner is not blowing cold even though they took it upon themselves to service the AC and charging $89 for that without notice. Neither of those problems were occurring prior to dropping it off. Needless to say, the truck was dropped back off to them within 30 minutes of pickup. We will be speaking with the so called mechanic on Monday. They also have problems with taking and returning calls. The only good thing I can say is that the owner Robert was nice and friendly. Let’s just see if they can make this right and I will come back and edit this post. But for now I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS SHOP, PERIOD.

name: Tiffani Johnson
text: I can't say enough good things about this company! Awesome experience with them, they replaced front rotors and brake pads on our car. They were VERY honest through the whole process. Was in and out within an hour, they didn't gouge us either! Highly, highly recommend them for any of your automotive needs!

resp.text: Thank you so much and for your business to our shop.

name: The Smith’s
text: Run! I took my car in for a noise on with my passenger side, water coming into my floorboard and ac not cooling. They charged my extended warranty over $1700 to redo my ac and I paid another $1200 for my front end work. The first week I had my car back it started making an awful noise. I took my car to another mechanic and he found that Integrity put no bolts in one of my brakes and it fell behind the caliber. The mechanic said he couldn’t believe I didn’t have an accident. I took it back in 6/15 due to the ac pouring water and still having a front end noise. They had my car until the afternoon of the 19th and said they had everything fixed. We left for vacation the 20th and half way to our destination the ac started pouring water in the passenger floorboard when it’s on. I’ve had my car back since the 19th of June but it’s sat in my barn the past 3 weeks. My transmission light is now on and it won’t shift gears. I had ABSOLUTELY NO problems with my transmission prior to my car going there and my AC now leaks constantly. I’m to the point of getting an attorney. I saw it was a veteran owned business and being that my husband is a veteran as well, I thought it would be great to support them. This is the biggest mistake I could have made.

resp.text: Fake customer

The motor acted like it was going to quit every time you would stop. And it honestly sounded like the shocks in the car were completely gone. Not a good experience at all!!😤

name: Bryan Wood
text: I rarely write reviews but I thought I'd take time to highly recommend Quality GM Transmission Rebuilders!  They went above and beyond to help me when my 2007 Yukon transmission went out.  I had a deadline to get it back by to use the vehicle for towing and they were able to meet my deadline plus a day...   They recommended rebuilding the transmission as a 4l70 with upgraded parts and I chose the HD upgrade and 3 year warranty.   Ashley was great and communicated with me and called me back multiple times as I had questions or needed to check in.   Amazing service and can't recommend them more highly.   These days to get good customer service is like finding  a unicorn and I did!  Drove the vehicle home yesterday and it shifted great and drove great, very happy with the work they performed.  Hope this helps someone else looking for a transmission shop.

name: Bridget Smith
text: This “mechanic” shop damaged a customers vehicle by not properly shutting the hood before a test drive, the hood FLEW OFF and obviously damaged it. Told the customer AFTER payment was received that they had a “little mishap” during the test drive. They refuse to pay for damages. Complete crooks.

resp.text: First we're not a mechanic shop. We are a transmission shop. And also you not being a customer or ever been a customer, legally you can't post reviews. But besides all of that. The hood never flew off the vehicle period. You were obviously mis informed. I personally explained to the owner of the vehicle what happened and how it happened. One more time, the hood latches broke on the hood while I personally was closing it. Properly closing it is putting your hands on the front of the hood at the latche and pulling and pushing it downward until it latches. Hoods are opened and closed here all day everyday. The vehicle is a 1993 model trans am. Someone had just put new shocks on the hood that were obviously wayyy too stiff period for a hood and also on a aged fiberglass hood that had already had the brackets jb welded previously. Its kind of common sense if you put boards under the middle two sides of the hood and pull down on it something is going to or will give. He needs to go after who installed the shocks on the vehicle not blame someone in which someone else's ignorance caused it to break. You are wanting to put the blame on the wrong issue, its not that it broke its Why it broke in the first place. You calling me a crook is obsurd especially when we've never had any dealing whatsoever. And also with this customer in particular he was told the wrong price initially and we had already pulled his transmission and was bringing it to the back for breakdown when it got noticed that it was listed as a 4l60 and was a 700r4 which is a $250 or so price difference. I told the secretary about the change on the build sheet and to not call the customer to change his price since we had already began working on it and he was told a lower price. Someone else probably would have called the customer and tried to get the money back on the build but I ate it because he was told wrong and we was already in the process of getting it done. I deal with everyone/everything this way. I take full responsibility every time for my or someone at the company mishaps but not someone else's. I hope you or yall understand. Thanks

name: Dustin Bradds
text: My wife and I were on our way to Florida  from Ohio when our transmission went out.  It was a Sunday afternoon and everything was closed. We got Phillips name from a man who said he could help us. We were about 40 miles away from him when we lost third gear. We were able to limp it to his shop where he met us On his day off. He got our truck in the next day and rebuilt our transmission. He is one of the most caring and honest mechanic I have ever met. Something still wasn't right when he rebuilt the transmission but he didn't want us to miss our vacation so told us to drive his truck to Florida while he worked on ours!! We had a great time in Florida and picked our truck up on the way home. Unfortunately about an hour after we got it back we lost third gear again. We called him and he told us to bring it back. He ended up putting a whole new transmission in at no extra cost!! If you ever need someone to fix your transmission Phillip Frost is the person to use! We can't say enough good things about him and his shop!

name: coldcuts coldcuts
text: Outstanding customer service.  I was blown away at how he truly did everything he could to help me during a tough spot.  My family and I were traveling to Florida this past summer and had the transmission go out right south of Dothan on highway 230.  I started calling shops but of course it was Sunday.  Gary happened to be in his shop and answered.  Even though he was only there for a short errand, he waited for me to bring the car by.  Though he couldn't fix it right then, he called the local rental car agency and helped me get a rental.  I went on to Florida and he conducted diagnostics and held it for the whole week.  He offered straightforward advice on the repair.  I chose to sell the car since it was older.  He had it in enough working order for me to get it to a local dealer to sell it.  Through it all he answered many calls and went through much effort for virtually no money to help us out and save our vacation and I am extremely grateful.

name: Efrain Rodriguez
text:
Here my car got the transmission rebuilt, torque converter changed, etc... I paid over 2K bucks for the repair with 3-year warranty. Now my car is shifting gears kinda funny, sometimes earlier than should, sometimes later... So, I took the car back to AAMCO because is still on warranty. After the 1st workday, I did not get a phone call. Seem like they are not used to customers or they don't know that they are supposed to call the customer even if did not have time to check the car. I would appreciate a courtesy call and a reasonable plan to fix the issue, let's see how long that takes. Unfortunately, today will have to walk home. I will continue updating this post...
The second day, 1st thing in the morning I got the call. One positive aspect about this Shop is that they keep their eyes on the rates and reviews. Looks like the previous owner messed up very bad with customers and the new people at the shop are trying very hard to fix the bad reputation. By phone, I got a fair enough excuse of why they did not call me yesterday and they have a plan to fix the car issue, which btw should not cost me a dime because the transmission rebuild is still on warranty...

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. This store is under new ownership. We have been here since June of 2017. Even though we are under new management and you bought and paid for this under the previous owner, I will be honoring your warranty and fixing your transmission. We are dedicated to our customers and want you to know we contact our customers are soon as a thorough diagnosis is completed. We have to schedule the vehicles into the shop as they are received and then we call the customer to inform them on what the issue is and how long it will take to complete the repair. We strive to meet our customers needs and understand you want your vehicle repaired as soon as possible.

name: Mickey Mcduffee
text: I run a business that specifically deals with one brand. I received a call from them about a problem they were having with a vehicle. We took the time to find out what the manufacture required to fix this issue. Plus we had seen this problem before. We told them what parts were needed for the repair so the customers car would be repaired long term. We sent the parts that were needed and a few days later they returned have the parts and said the car was repaired. OK... I don't know what he did but I do know they did not fix the car they way the manufacture suggested. Burke the owner originally paid with a check. So I had him a check cut for the returns which he cashed the next day. Then my business office tells me he canceled the original check he used to pay for the parts. I called and he told me several times he would come by and pay for the parts. This was the first couple times he lied to me. Finally I drove to his business and talked face to face where he gave me some excuse why he did not have the funds but he would pay tomorrow. It was always tomorrow. I would pull up and he would run and jump in his car and drive off like a coward. Even his own employees  said he was a layer. So do yourself a favor and find another repair shop. And if you own a shop and do business with Burke DONT TAKE A CHECK (CASH ONLY!) To this day he has not paid a dime of his bill. And I am sure if I called he would lie to me right now!

name: Joshua Mott
text: They do a really good job. I'd recommend them to anyone

resp.text: Thanks for the great review Joshua. We are glad you were satisfied with the work we did on your vehicle. Come back and see us anytime.

I took this car in to this location three times each time the work took 1-2 weeks for the same repair.  The last time this franchise kept my car for three weeks provided a rental car for one of those weeks.  A got the car back only to discover the D5 LED was flashing indicating a high pressure switch problem which was denied by this franchise as a warranty item!  Use them at your own risk!

text: I can't overstate how much I appreciate this shop.  Long Lewis Ford gave me an estimate for over $4,000.00 for a new transmission (E350 drivetrain). Previously, I had Bacon do a transmission service at 195,000 miles on my Ford F-150.  They fixed a glitch that Ford dealers could never get a handle on - when I accelerated hard between 30-40 mph, it would miss.  No longer!

name: rtc
text:
Went in for new shocks and coils, they installed them well, but when I started driving, my vehicle constantly pulled to the left. If I didn't hold the steering wheel tight it would have flipped at high speeds. So I called them and they swore they had done an alignment. I asked if they'd check again to make sure it was done right and they begrudgingly said yes. Took it back in, they said everything looked great. I drove it off the lot and there was still a severe pull to the left. They blamed my tires and said it's because they had a bad wear pattern. (My tires were only a few months old).

So I took it to another place on the other side of the river. They did an alignment and told me that whoever had done my previous alignment lied to me. They showed me on a print out how the camber was over an inch out of line and how the toe of one wheel was turned too far in. I drove off the lot and my vehicle drove as straight as an arrow.

Bacon Alignment lied to me twice and charged me for something they didn't do. Avoid.

name: Richard Brewton
text:
I looked for over a month for the SIERRA I wanted. I had received several emails from Brooks but because of the distance from home I avoided making the drive.  After a frustrating Saturday talking to other dealers, I told my wife Rae I was driving to Thomasville Monday to see what they had.  Rae suggested we make the drive that afternoon.

I never expected to be driving a new SIERRA home that afternoon.

We arrived at Brooks late on Saturday afternoon.  I walked on the lot and found the Sierra I had wanted all along.  Neil was very helpful with the test drive and answering our question.

I had done a lot of research on USAA's car buying site and TrueCar's site as will.  When Neil presented Brooks pricing, it was well within the range  I expected to pay.  The financing was in line with the research I had done as well.

Neil, Kelly and Preston were very gracious staying after hours to complete our transaction.

Rae and I agreed this was the best experience either of us had ever experienced when purchasing a new vehicle. Relaxed, no anxiety and we left totally satisfied with every aspect of the transaction.

Thank you to all!!

PS: THE COOKIES WERE FABULOUS !!!!

resp.text: We're happy to hear that you found our staff so helpful, Richard! We sincerely appreciate your business and kind review. We hope to see you again in the future! Safe travels!

Came to the dealership explaining my vehicle is randomly stalling out. Which is extremely dangerous. If I stalled out in a busy intersection, red light, or train tracks, I could die. I've worked in the service department industry for years and years before I had my kids and from my knowledge it's a liability to turn away a customer if their car is doing anything that could put you in danger. Well, this dealership did.

That's okay though. I'll call a lawyer if anything happens to me or my family. I'm headed to Chris Myers GMC.

text: I am super impressed with this place.  I spoke with Chip after being referred to World Transmission for a roaring sound at highway speed on July 2.  He wasn't able to fit me in before being closed for the 4th but STILL took a ride in the car,   got under it, diagnosed the problem AND told me exactly what to tell a mechanic to do with it.   If I have any more transmission problems this is the FIRST place I'll be taking my car.

text: After the dealership attempted to make it easy on themselves by recommending a replacement transmission ($$) at 69k miles, I brought the vehicle here for a second opinion. Chip and his team took the time to diagnose the root cause of the problem, which turned out to be an electronic sensor/solenoid issue for an otherwise mechanically sound transmission. They didn't do what was easiest for them, but rather what was best for me. Knowledgeable team, straight advice, good price.

He was helpful in pointing me in the direction of getting this corrected. Great five star service and will return for any other issues that come about.

Chip runs an honest shop and his staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.

Last year I recommend him to a friend for a 2006 Mercury Grand Marquis trans. problem.  She had been told it need to be rebuilt (if was slipping bad) and quoted over $1800. I said okay, thinking they were working on it, and just needed to tweak a couple things before it was ready. Well come to find out they NEVER even touched my car. It's a week and a half now, and I had to call a tow-truck to get it to another shop (aamco)...so instead of having my car back in a few days, it's now going to be 2 weeks before it's done. name: Dwayne Carmichael
text: Do not take your vehicle to this place. I brought my BMW X5 there to have the water pump replaced. They replaced the water pump, but damaged other parts on my vehicle while doing the repair. I was quoted $360 labor to replace the water pump. I called to check on my vehicle later that evening, and Yvonne said that her technician was having a hard time installing the water pump and that they had to charge me an extra hour worth of labor. Who fault is that? I told them no way, so they only charged me the $360 that I was originally quoted. However they did mentioned that my car needed 2 more repairs and quoted me $563 for one and $440 for the other. The $440 repair was for a hose that was damaged while they were changing the pump. The hose cost $40 from the BMW dealership and they said it would be 4 hours of labor, which didn't sound right for a hose. I called 3 other independent shops and was quoted $130 for the same repair parts and labor. The $563 was for a hood latch and cable, the parts at dealer are $80. Yvonne also said it would be 4 hours labor. I called several independent shops and was quoted $200 for parts and labor. I guess 4 is there magic number. When I asked Yvonne to double check those quotes all of a sudden she wasn't able to find the labor rates in the system. How did she come up with those figures initially? Bottom line do not take your car to these ppl. Yvonne charges you whatever she feels like and that's not right.

resp.text: We remember you well.  You brought your car late one afternoon with a coolant leak,  and we drove you across town to take you home. You didn't mention that your hood latch was locked and would not open. We spent quite a while to opened the hood to replace the water pump that you brought for us to install, and you declined the hood repair knowing that it would not reopen once it was shut.  We actually charged less labor to install the water pump than the labor guide prescribes.  We also told you about another coolant leak that you say we caused, but we did not; you also declined that repair.  Yes, we would normally charge more because of the extra work to open your hood because of the latch and cable.  Your car came in with several problems, but none caused by us.  We did our best to accommodate you in every way and we're sorry you left dissatisfied.

name: Rico Suave
text: Dropped my car off for a radiator change. It took about a week to just get an estimate when I was told it would be looked at the following morning. When I finally got the estimate, it was on the high end, quoted a few more hours than normal. Continuously called to try to get information over the next week! Was lied to several times throughout the two weeks and one day for a radiator change! Wasn't even notified when they required another part.  On top of it, the manager/owner referred to me as a "damn Yankee". Great business savvy you moron. If you want over priced work, dishonesty, ignorant management this is the place for you. Honestly, the worst experience I've ever had at a car maintenance facility.

resp.text: Sorry, Mr. Suave, but we have no record of you ever being in our shop.  We take our reviews very seriously, but you must have us confused with another shop.

text: You drop your car off seven or eight days later no one calls you they tell your car is done and it cost $2000 to fix they fix my car with no approval I said OK paid the bill picked it up less than 10 days later I start to hear funky noise like something is loose then transmission fluid starts pouring all out of it  end it won’t move they send a wrecker after it same thing car sits there for almost 4 weeks no one calls me tells me the car is done I come to pick it up drive home put about 400 miles on it guess what car won’t move call him they tell me to bring it in don’t even offer it to tow it back wake they came and got it finally Repeated the same thing 3Weeks later I called to check on my car how they say it’s ready to go said they had a fluid leak told me that park the car out front I come to pick it up it’s dark and raining guess what the car won’t start won’t crank nothing popped the hood the negative battery cable was loose reconnect it car still is dead as a hammer. It’s late it’s dark come back the next day car won’t even jumpstart the battery is so dead go to get a battery put a battery in it started and the emergency brake light won’t go off like they adjusted the emergency break wrong drive it home will never go back oh by the way when I went to pick it up the driver side floor board was full mud . Don’t take your car there

text: I contacted Alabama Precision Transmission to get an estimate on a new transmission for my Nissan. I spoke with Michael (Mike) and he worked hard and got me the best deal possible! He went above and beyond to get me what I needed and I would never go anywhere else!

name: Kaitlyn Shotwell
text:
My car broke down about 20 miles south of Montgomery, and the Firestone on Maxwell AFB recommended this place as a reputable transmission specialist. My first impression walking in was not favorable, as the owners smoke indoors and it is not well maintained. I would say the highlight of this place is the employees, because they were super helpful and polite as my car was put into the garage. Be careful if you have insurance; once I brought up that my insurance might cover the work, the owner got really shady and kept telling me that it wasn't a good idea to contact my insurance company. I ended up leaving my car here for about a week and I heard no updates from the store and they wouldn't answer any phone calls. I decided I didn't want to conduct business with these folks anymore. When I finally got the owner on the phone, he protested that the job would cost me about $6,000, but calling around and showing the invoice to other mechanics in the area, they told me they would do the same job for about $4,000. I ended up having the car towed to the dealership because of the bad vibes I got with APT.

In summary, I cannot attest to their expertise fixing the car, but I definitely didn't like their low level of professionalism. Two and a half stars.

name: Jim Johnson
text: Had my Jeep Commander in the dealership for 3 1/2 months trying to settle with insurance company for damage caused by towing company.  When I finally settled the dealership wanted me to pay upfront the cost of parts, somewhere around $4000.  I took it to Mr Transmission, had it fixed for $2300 less than the dealership and was treated great by Scott.  Now if it holds up I will be one happy camper.

name: belinda walker
text: They did a wonderful job and had great turn around time!!!

name: candace Merritt
text:
First of all, if it was possible to leave a 0 I would. Second, these people obviously think we are fools. After getting the truck back on March 30 we have had to replace at least five starters. Come to find out the problem is the flex plate, which is a part that is SUPPOSED to be inspected to make sure it is in good working condition, prior to returning the truck to the customer. This part IS IN FACT a part that is affected by working on the transmission. Now they tell us that “even though it’s not their fault they will only charge labor if we buy the part to fix it” $500 more worth of labor. Now if it’s not their fault then why “fix” something they didn’t break. Just beware if you take your vehicle because you may end up like us. Vehicle that still won’t run and $3600 in debt.
Also don’t believe their add for free towing with all major repairs. Even though it’s not stated on their webpage it’s only free towing up to 40 miles but they won’t tell you that until after they’ve already towed.

resp.text: We're sorry for your inconvenience, Let me say your truck was in perfect order when it left our shop or it would have been addressed before you picked it up. Eight weeks later it came back with a bad starter and flex plate which had nothing to do with the transmission repair.

name: Ricky Moore
text: Took my 2003 Toyota Rav4 in with transmission problems, would not shift into 4th. Gear. Was told the transmission was bad and would cost $2195.00 to repair. Took it to Advance Mechinics and told the Service Manager the problem. He said they were backed up for at least at a week. I told him I had done some research on this vehicle and the research said there was usually a problem with the ECM Modgule and if they worked on it they would have to take it to the Toyota Dealership and have it reprogrammed. To make a long story short I sent the ECM Module to a company in Buford Georgia and had it repaired at a cost of $75.00 plus $15.00 shipping for a total of $90.00, now the Transmission works like a charm. A long way from $2195.00.

resp.text: We at Mr. Transmission are fully aware of the problem of the ecm/pcm module, However given the age and high milage of the vehicle this particular transmisson it has faults that has to be corrected internally before any warranty can be issued also the module was is and always included in the price given. We also do not use repaired electronics only certified remanufactored modules. If those arent available then OEM parts are used. We did exactly what Mr. Moore asked from us.   Thank You

name: Joseph Taylor
text: If you are unfortunate to have transmission trouble these are the guys to go too. They worked hard to get my truck running right, and now it runs better than ever. Great customer service. Great people.

text:
Extremely good svc! I have 97 Tahoe they rebuilt and beefed-up trans. I cannot say enough good things. Works Great! I highly recommend for any auto trans svc you need.

name: Ted Wernimont
text:
On April 4,  I was cruising along 15 miles south of Dothan, Alabama heading back to Iowa City, Iowa when the transmission in my 2010 Dodge Caravan totally locked up to the point it stalled the engine and the van would not move...the nightmare for a 70 year old couple in a strange state. I asked the kid who drove the tow truck "If I was your uncle, where would tell me to take your my car for transmission work?"
He said "My dad always went to Mr. Transmission." I told him, "That's where we are going."

They were very professional, getting the car in immediately and quoting me a price that was a large sum to rebuild the 6 speed transmission. Scott said they could start that afternoon, put me ahead of a couple jobs and get me back on the road in a day or two at the most. I had no choice so we shook hands.
In private I called the transmission dealer in Iowa City with a great reputation and asked if the price was reasonable. The answer was yes, right in the ballpark.

I am now back in Iowa City. We were on the road by 4:00 the next day and the car has run perfect since.
Thank you to all the staff, especially Scott. You helped greatly to make an initially frightening experience into a seamless 24 hours where we felt supported and in good hands.
Admittedly, I held my breath the first few hours after leaving Dothan. But here we are back home for two weeks and the tranny is smooth as silk.
Thanks again, Ted and Yvonne

name: Joseph Owen
text: Five star experience all the way around. Should be 10 stars. Truck broke down on the interstate and was able to limp it to the next exit. Called my roadside assistance company and they gave me their number for a tow. Well the issue was, I had a camper in tow. Nancy answered the phone and was immediately willing to help. They came with a tow truck for my truck and a dually for the camper. They towed my truck to their shop and my camper to the campground. Because we were traveling they moved me to the front of the line and Mike and I had spoken on the phone and thank goodness his phone diagnosis was spot on. 2–3 hours later and my truck was fixed. I had already booked the campground for the night, so we stayed. All I can say is they went out of their way to help us out and even offered to take us grocery shopping if we needed to. You just don’t get service like that everywhere and I am truly appreciative for everything they did. Even thought I don’t live in the area, I would highly recommend Mike, Nancy, and the family for great prices and service!!!!

STAY AWAY IF YOU HAVE TRANSMISSION TROUBLE
Not sure what happened in two years, but we had a horrible experience here.  It started off great but our transmission had troubles the day after we brought it home and after calling,  he kept telling us that it wasn't the transmission and kept telling us to try something else. After jumping through ALL his hoops, we found out that it WAS a problem with his transmission and proved it to him. It was a very frustrating experience and I wouldn't recommend anyone going to him. In our case it seemed he refused to believe anything was wrong with his work. A man working that long on transmissions definitely should've known there was a problem. He eventually told us that he would redo his work,  but this was a month after telling us we were wrong and that there was nothing wrong with his. work . We had to get our transmission replaced somewhere else and he never tried to make it right with us other than to say he'd redo his work.  At this point neither of us trusted him to touch our vehicle. Please stay away if you have transmission trouble.

name: Sonja Renea
text:
I dropped my truck off on Friday to have the crank shaft pulley replaced. I provided the part. I picked it up Monday. I could not leave because the battery was dead. Never had that problem before. RED FLAG.

The mechanic there said something ridiculous to me about all the car batteries in their lot going dead since the hailstorm, or something to that effect. I guess I'm a stupid woman and would just accept that ludicrous statement as truth. RED FLAG. He jumped me off quickly, and left me there with my hood up. ANOTHER RED FLAG.

Then we figure it out. My boyfriend noticed my brake lights were not going off. There were pieces of one of my brake light stopper in my floorboard. The other stopper is just missing. These are the parts that keep your brake lights off until you hit the brake.

So now my brake lights were draining my battery. I had no issues with my brakes or battery when I left it with them. The truck obviously had made it to their lot after the repair, but then the battery died. Any person with half a brain can see what happened here.

I contacted the owner, who defended his techs, but offered to "fix" this problem IF IT REALLY HAPPENED. Unfortunately I do not trust this shop to touch my vehicle at this point. I have not even driven it enough to know if the crank shaft pulley was installed correctly because I am waiting on brake stoppers from Nissan.

He seemed angry that I would question his "integrity"... WELL WHY WOULDN'T I?

So $113 later, my two cents: Save yourself the hassle. I was married to a mechanic for 24 years... and some of them do this to women who they assume will not know any better, so they will bring their vehicle back to be "fixed".... It's not surprising to me that these guys have a "Ladies Day" ... I bet they get a lot of repeat business. I did notice among all their suspicious 5 star reviews the few who did have a complaint were also women. Maybe they assume we need a man to TALK to a mechanic. Or they think people like me will see that they are "Christian" business and expect them to NOT SCREW ME over. I am a single mom with a son on disability... and I cannot trust the vehicle they just "fixed."

name: Michelle Kuznicki
text:
I was heading to Gulf Shores, AL from Hazel Green, AL when my 2014 Jeep took a nosedive in Prattville, AL. After taking it to a Jeep dealership up there, and getting the call that nothing was wrong diagnostically and to come get my vehicle, I started my journey to Gulf Shores once again the next day.

However, about an hour into my drive my Jeep failed again. I chose D and D Automotive at random because I was in the middle of nowhere and had zero clue about my surroundings. I am so glad I did.

After my insurance company got me safely to their shop via tow truck, both Mr. Gary and Joe helped diagnose the issue (it was in fact the alternator), explained the repair to me, checked on me several times (mind you, I was in their shop for close to 6 hours with no where to go), and were incredibly knowledgeable about their trade.

I grew up around cars and can tell pretty quickly when people are in this business to rip off those in need and I can say, without-a-doubt, this shop genuinely cares about their patrons and those they serve. They could have *easily* waited to work on my car the next day but they were immediate in their desire to help and get me back on the road.

I could not be more thankful for their help and cannot recommend them enough. Hearts of gold and quality work, D and D Automotive is the place to go.

resp.text: Michelle, thank you so much for the positive feedback. We appreciate the 5 STARS!  We are so glad we would get you back on the road.   We appreciate your business and let us know if we can ever assist you again. Safe travels!

name: Friday Gustav
text:
Absolutely wonderful place.  The employees there are very very friendly, professional and THEY REALLY REALLY KNOW THEIR CRAFT!  They have taken the time and effort it takes to be masters at what they do.  One of the employees there blew me away with an encyclopedic knowledge of the rare transmission and clutch I needed work on.  Not only was this gentleman highly knowledgeable about my needs but recommended other business that provided a plethora of services that saved me hundreds of dollars.  Even though they could have easily convinced me to buy parts from them, they listened to my problems and needs (for my car of course) and EVEN THOUGH THEY WOULD HAVE MADE A SIGNIFICANTLY SMALLER PROFIT they directed me to the places i needed to, in order to save money and accomplish the needs of my car.

I was completely gracious of their honesty, friendliness  and professionalism so it came to be of no surprise when their labor cost for my car's need was UNDER 175 DOLLARS than the cheapest place I could find in all of Tuscaloosa (I called and or spoke to 17 different auto shops that could handle the job i needed).  This along with all the other amazing traits of this company left me incredibly happy.

As a customer I could not ask for more or better service because THEY REALLY ARE THE BEST.  I hope much and continued sucess for these guys and gals because they are all AWESOME AND GREAT PEOPLE and this unfortunately a rare thing.

Thank you all for a wonderful experience.

-Albert

We see that our Service Manager spoke with you on Saturday, 1/30, to answer any questions you may have had about your warranty. At Greenway Toyota, customer satisfaction is our top priority, and we hope that we were able to demonstrate that by providing you with a prompt call back. Should you have any further questions, please feel free to reach out to our Service Manager, Keith Inman, at Keithinman@toyotaoftheshoals.com. Thank you for your patience.

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Went in for tires however I had a brake light and headlight out on the driver side and had asked if they could fix it. I was told to come back that Saturday; May 2nd so that a mechanic can look at it. I went that Saturday and had the lights repaired. That same Saturday night my entire driver side taillight went out. I knew they were closed Sunday but I called just in case I could leave a voicemail to give them a heads up about me coming in on Monday; May 4th regarding the taillight. May 4th they tried to repair the issue however ALL of my lights started malfunctioning. They tell me to come back that Wednesday; May 6th so that their mechanic can look at it. They gave me a work order stating that they are working on diagnosing the problem in case I got pulled over for no brake lights, reverse lights, headlights or turn signal. They proceeded to pull my vehicle through the shop and when I got inside it I noticed an airbag sensor that was not there before. I asked John if he could have it cleared out and he said that he would have the mechanic do it on Wednesday and that it should be no problem. I then attempted to turn my AC on (which was on while they were working on it but John said that he had turned it off) but the AC wouldn't come on. I get out of my vehicle and ask John if he could have the code cleared because I felt that it was messing with the operation of my AC and it's been 90° lately. John then tells another employee named Skyler to come clear the code however the code does not clear. During this time the owner comes and introduces himself and asked me and another customer if we were being tended to, the other customer stated that he was already tended to then I stated that I was being tended to and pointed to my vehicle. The owner then leaves to never return again. They then proceeded to turn the vehicle off in hopes of resetting it however at that point the vehicle would no longer start. John then told me that I needed to leave and that I could return Wednesday to have their mechanic look at it but at this point, I had no dash lights, interior lights, exterior lights, no AC, no radio, no power steering, and sensors going off. The vehicle would no longer start up. I started to get upset, John claims I brought my vehicle in like that which is 100% untrue, I drove it in with no issues other than the driver taillight but I was unable to drive it away. I defended myself and vehicle over that statement then John pulled their doors closed while several employees including a manager/ assistant manager watched. I ended up having to call the police (because I had no clue what else I could or should do). The shop then claimed that I had a bad battery and that was the result of all of this however when they put a brand new battery in there it did NOT fix all the problems, the vehicle did start up and it did have headlights but that was it. After me refusing to tow my vehicle away and almost 2 hours later Mitch (I believe the manager or assistant manager) then offered to let the vehicle stay and have their mechanic look at it on Wednesday May 6th. May 6th, I went to go pick up my vehicle and John was working the front desk, they tried to hand me my keys in the lot hoping I would just leave immediately but when I asked for a full detail work order on what all had been done to my vehicle, I received attitude and was told that I should be happy that they fixed it for free and that they don't document all the work that's done on vehicles. I sat up there until I received a work order (over 30mins later) but when I received the "work order" it stated, "gave customer a battery and replaced 10 fuse". I told the mechanic that that was not a detailed work order but I was told that was all I was going to get. I do not believe that they would have fixed the damages their employee, John, caused to my vehicle if I did not have 4years of documentation from the one and only other mechanic I've been to, video footage from my own vehicle and computer readings from my Vivint smart security proving the condition of my vehicle.

It is always a good idea to replace it when recommended by the manufacturer so that it doesn't break and destroy the motor.

text: I am at Mr T’s shop with my daughter and the manner of communication given to my daughter by an employee was unprofessional i.e. talking about her hair and children; stating that he understands why her hair is “glued on” since she has so many children. when we returned immediately after picking up her car because of engine light being on he stated well you might as well get it fixed too since you have your income tax money......very rude and appears to have an set opinion of certain people. Know this; all people of color are not ignorant to employee’s or employers who  apparently  do not have their facts or business etiquette in order. We are waiting outside over an hour for wiring to sensor to correct check engine light. I have had to cancel my business appointments today by the way is how we paid for this fiasco. Such a bad way to earn business from customers however they choose to pay

resp.text: Ms Grant, I am very sorry that you were offended that certainly was not my intention. Let me first say that I am not a racist person, my business would not have survived 30 plus years in a predominately black community if I was. I try to treat my customers like family or at  least like a close friend without the thought that some people may take offense to it. I often come into the lobby and interact with my customers, mostly to let them know they are more to me than just a dollar. I believe that most appreciate that or I wouldn't have been here as long as I have. My business is built on word of mouth from family member to family member, friends to friends then coworkers and others. I know the majority of my customers by name, I know their spouses, mothers and fathers, sisters and brothers and their children. Again, I apologize for offending you and I truly hope that I have not lost your daughters business through this misunderstanding.

So I called him and told him what was going on with the car again he told me to bring it back up there again Monday ..  they are very nice he is not give me any problems about bringing my car back up there but I just want my car fixed  so I will keep you guys posted with this review after I pick my car up after Monday  to be continued...

name: Doyle Bright
text:
Mr T's automotive strives to satisfy the customer Matt Tortorici is very knowledgeable he has been working with cars and building engines from back in the mid 70's .  I had a coolant leakage problem with my GMC 1500 Sierria 5.3 liter Truck.  GM used defective castech heads casting#706 from 2002 thru 2007 they were made in China. The heads will crack at the head bolts causing coolant to leak into engine. GM would not fix the Issue and had multiple other shops in the Birmingham area try and repair the same old casting 706 and it would last for around 60k miles and crack again.  We put casting 243 heads on my 2002 5.3 liter
and so far so good it seems to have lost little low end but picked up some upper end power. Matt went over everything with me and even steamed cleaned my engine also repaired my AC.  I highly recommend Mr T's / Matt Tortorici he didi exceleent job on my Truck.. MShelto

You're very eager to provide a speedy response to a public review, but if you were as eager to provide excellent customer service you wouldn't have so many negative reviews to respond to. Provide this same eagerness, and willingness to provide clarification when a customer is standing before you, with questions about their invoice or inquiries about such lengthy auto repair times. This review is not worthy of your response as I've already heard all of your excuses and even read some of them in your responses to reviews. My Mechanic is on vacation, waiting for parts to arrive, dealing with a warranty issue etc. However none of this explains why it took 3 months to render repairs, why were there services on my invoice that had not been performed on my vehicle and why my vehicle is not in drivable condition today. When this issue was presented to the business owner instead of him treating a paying consumer with respect, I was met with, anger, frustration, he himself had a lack of understanding, unwillingness to explain, lack of empathy. He was truly unconcerned and appeared as if he didn't care. No need for your public, heartfelt, speedy response.

Robbers.  I am going to report this place to the Better Business Bureau..  cause they need to be  shut down now he want me to spend $400  on a computer. Why  all of a sudden my computer is bad.. it was nothing wrong with my computer before I took it up there to you guys..they will call you with bad news after news.what they will give you. Please people do not take your car here I would hate to see someone else being treated the way I am.

resp.text:
Do you know the legal liability you have imposed on yourself by posting a malicious business review with a fake Google account? You should look it up. With that said here is our reply to your review.
I am sorry you are having an issue after the repair but an engine replacement is just that, the engine along with any extra parts that we felt were questionable and they are listed on your invoice. There is not an ECM on your invoice. Please keep in mind that there are several other things under the hood of your car that can also cause future problems. Unfortunately we are not able to detect a component such as an ECM, starter, alternator, Oxygen Sensor, Injector and so on that is about to go bad, it is just impossible. Your vehicle is 11 years old and does have 175,000 miles on and usually parts and components will begin to fail and need replacing after 10 years. This ECM is not covered under warranty because we did not replace this part and it does not come with an engine. I have copied and pasted some information for you that came from a site called my mechanic explaining the ECM’s function to your car. We have ordered the ECM, as you know, and as soon as it is installed and the car is test drove we will call you.
Here is some information that I pulled from the site "My Mechanic" that may help you better understand an ECM's function.
The engine control module (ECM), also commonly referred to as the engine control unit (ECU) or powertrain control module (PCM), is one of the most important components found on virtually all  vehicles. It essentially functions as the main computer for many of the vehicle’s engine performance and drivability functions. The ECM takes the information from the engine's various sensors and uses that information to calculate and tune engine spark and fuel for maximum power and efficiency. Erratic engine behavior also indicates a bad or failing ECM. A faulty computer may cause the vehicle to intermittently stall or misfire. The symptoms might come and go and not appear to have any sort of pattern to their frequency or severity. The ECM plays a vital role in engine performance. Any issues with it can cause major problems with the overall functionality of the car.

name: Soul Jah
text:
WARNING! WARNING! ...Avoid at all cost!! This business is not what they claim they are. My P30 Step Van was towed in to get a refreshing and almost had to be towed away. I heard their ad on the radio, gave them a call and found out they service Cintas vans. I spoke to the owner Matt on the phone and he assured me that he was the place to come to and he would take care of me. I told him what I wanted done, I also left a list with the most important to be taken care of first (fuel tank leak and master cylinder replacement) with the receptionist. I mentioned new tires but didn’t decide what to install, but he did, and installed them without my consent. Later he said he thought that’s what I wanted “the cheap ones.” He decided to do what he wanted and void my concerns (that I spoke of on every visit). I was charged over $400.00 in parts (radiator, v belt and lug nuts) plus labor @ $74/hour added without my consent nor were they spoken of when I made payments in person. I was charged ($35.00) for an air cleaner that he had left from a previous vehicle and promised that he wouldn’t charge me for since I was getting so much work done. That Monday of week three, I stopped by to realize no work had been done over the past 5 days and I immediately stopped the work and told them I would be back in the morning to pick up and pay off balance. Next morning I waited over and hour for the motor to be pressure washed like he promised it would be done yesterday by lunch. While waiting he then decided that he would for free replace the master cylinder and patch the fuel tank leak with a $6.00 putty instead of replacing the tank like I asked on day one. All while repairs being done there were no actual receipt/list of parts and labor but guesstimations made until I made final payment. After I reviewed the receipt just before I paid the remaining $1,400+ balance I had to request that Matt break down and fix the double charges on receipt (I was so angry that I missed a few issues on the receipt). A week turned into a month and if I had not stopped the work there’s no telling how long it would have taken to get the van back. Now I’m weeks behind schedule on preparing for the van for body work and getting it wrapped.   The total cost was $3,863.68 and $1,417.25 of it was labor. I felt robbed and played. This place is not worthy of your money and will waste your time…. so please be advised! You are WARNED!!
CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS

H Russell Adair II
White 1984 Chevrolet P30 Step Van

P.S.
I was charged $30.00 for brake fluid even though he knew the master cylinder was bad. I realized this after I paid. Also, the paper work was drawn up and balance paid before he decided to replace master cylinder.
Matt told me the only man allowed to work on my vehicle had taken off several days due to court date and illness hence why the time frame was pushed back.
He spoke negatively about customers in front of me while they were on hold with the receptionist who also was not professional.

resp.text:
Hello Mr. Adair,
We are sorry that you are not happy-- our customers are very important to us. In all fairness, when the vehicle was diagnosed the owner did recommend that you not repair it because the repairs would be more than the vehicle was worth. Considering you had just purchased it, and it was a 1984, you didn’t know how well it was maintained hence lots of wear and tear does equal extensive repairs. Again we are very sorry and would like the opportunity to speak with you. Please call us at 205-786-8279. Thanks.

name: Kick Work
text: BAD REVIEW PLEASE  READ...This shop is the MOST disrespectful, unprofessional, money hungry group of people you can meet in the auto industry. I have spent over $10000 at this shop over the course of two years. THEY STOLE MY CAR.   WHEN I BROUGHT THE CAR IN IT WAS BLOWING BLACK SMOKE my car was brought in for a DAMAGED "OIL COOLER". A MAN BY THE NAME OF ROB claims he replaced the part totaling $650.  He then claimed he started the car and the engine failed.  Any MECHANIC WITH HALF OF A BRAIN KNOWS THE SYMPTOMS OF A BLOWN MOTOR...BLACK SMOKE MEANS MAJOR ISSUES HEKNEW THIS MOTOR IS BAD AND HE JUST WANTED A FREE CAR BECAUSE I CANT AFFORD TO GIVE AWAY $650 FOR NOTHING. This shop IS very expensive and NOT ONLY THAT they are shady and don't tell you what's really wrong with the car. They let you drive and break down again only to tell you that another part broke. DONT GO TO MR TS...I  WARNED YOU

text: I gave mr. T's Automotive over $10,000 of my business and I really wasn't satisfied the work is real shabby and you always have to go back for other reason he's never proactive about fixing older cars and they are very expensive

resp.text: Mr. Williams, I am surprised to hear this. Our records show the following services done for you since  2017: Electric Fuel Pump, Hydro Cylinder, Carburetor, Power Steering Pump, Clutch Slave Cylinder, 2 door handles, an oil change and battery charge, Thermostat Gasket and Housing, PVC Valve, Belt and Tensioner, rear Brakes, Hydraulic Winch, and a Distributor. You have come to Mr T's for 16 totally different repairs over a 2 year span. Futhermore, we originally advised you not to purchase this vehicle due to the repairs it would need. So it's no suprise to us that you've needed so much work done on the vehicle, and we've done the best that we can for you.  We understand that you don't need to use us any more, and we wish you well.

name: JM Doug
text: Like The Man Who Wears The Star ... you can trust your car to Mr. T's. (5 star business to me) I have over 40 years of owning used cars or trucks. All have needed mechanical work. It's not easy finding an Auto Shop that you can trust. I got lucky and found MR. T's. Twice they have helped me when I was in a bind :( They are very friendly , reasonable prices and their speed of service amazes me. I would like to THANK all employees and the owners of such a 1st. class business. I know they are not perfect BUT they try. I look forward to dealing with them again. Thanx again MR. T's. P.S. ..Petty, Earnheart and Force would want ya on Their team.

name: Eddie Holt
text: I had a motor put in my car in Mississippi, and after installation no one could get the car to start, including several locksmiths. Needless to say I remembered Mr T's from past experiences, and I went to the shop and explained my problem to them. I was told by the manager they that they can start it....folks, I hauled my car from Mississippi, and Mr T fixed it (and it was in a mess)! Also, they gave me a Military discount.....thank You Mr T...you did what no one else could do, and at an affordable price,....Ed Holt

Great job guys, keep up the good work!

e

name: Steve Allen
text: I work at a car Dealership and have used them for over 8 years.  They have saved us Thousands of dollars in repairs.  They are extremely honest people, quality work done right the first time, and there diagnostics are extremely accurate saving you on "Mechanics Guesswork".  Five Stars!

name: Bill Hunter
text:
AVOID THIS PLACE!! STAY AWAY!!
I wish I could give it ZERO stars if I could.
They do not deserve your time and money.
I have formally filed a complaint and also left a review on Better Business Bureau website to let them know how garbage of a business this place does with customers.

After deciding not to pursue further service from them, because of their outrageous pricing, they not only charged an "inspection fee" that was UNHEARD of, but also took out one of the expansive part from my vehicle. When I questioned them about it, I was only told they never took it and can come "check out" their shop to look for the part myself. Are you Kidding ME? (my vehicle was broken down and was in their lot the WHOLE time) I assume they were angry and did this as a way of getting back for deciding not to repair my vehicle with them.

BOTTOM LINE: I am saving you the trouble. Take your vehicle somewhere ELSE.

name: Jennifer Mckinley
text: Great service  nice people

name: James Gordon
text: I will be absolutely honest with you, if you have an option to go anywhere else but this business to get your vehicle fixed, please do so. You cant pay me enough to go back here. What a shame, as they continue to take advantage of your hard earned money. Avoid Avoid Avoid

text:
Had 2 different cars worked on there.
Both jobs were done right. I would recommend them.

text: They are good,honest hard working people, know what they are doing.

name: richard hammer
text: On a cross country trip my tranny went out,and had it towed to transmatic ,they rebuilt my transmission and when i headed out of town ,the transmission didn't even get 200 miles ,where i had to have a new one put in up in Decatur Al.When i called the owner he agreed to reimburse a good part of the charge,but he never did,it took me a year of dealing with my credit card company to get paid back.Even if these guys messed up and everyone messes up,their dishonesty,lying, and just figuring because i was passing through they could get away with it.do yourself a favor and steer clear of transmatic transmissions.     thank you

name: LeighAnn Gunter
text: Great service!

name: Kamera McGriff
text:
My husband and I feel God placed us in the best hands possible when the transmission to our F350, towing a 5th Wheel RV, stopped working in the middle of nowhere.
Words cannot express the stellar service we received, the sincere concern and special care of Kenny and his amazing team at Kenny Robbins Transmission.

They are TRUE Gladiators, some of the best people you'll ever meet. They went above and beyond.
They fought for our claim to be processed speedily without delay, allowed us to place our RV on their property with all the bells and whistles during the entire time it took to get us up and running... Superb hospitality! We are beyond grateful and count them now as family. They made sure we had no worries.

They took only a couple days to remove the bad transmission and install the new one. Our F350 takes off and pulls that 39ft 5th wheel RV up hills like never before.. amazing job, like new off the lot. Thanks Kenny, Kimberly, Leo and Jordan❤

name: Rebecca Williamson
text: WE HAD 2 VEHICLES  WE TOOK TO   KENNYS.ONE DODGE RAM(TRANSMISSION REBUILT) AND ONE 2018 CAMARO SERVICED WE WAS VERY PLEASED AND PRICES WERE VERY REASONABLE..HE TAKES TIME TO CARE AND NO DOUBLE TALK I HIGHLY SUGGEST GOING TO HIM FOR ALL YOUR TRANMISSION OR DIAGNOSTIC NEEDS.MY HUSBAND WILL NOT GO ANYWHERE ELSE!!THANK YOU KENNY.I WILL HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU ALWAYS

text: tGreat company and great people. I hope you will become the greatest company in the world soon. Greetings to the Queen

text: They have repaired the transmission in two of my vehicles over the past few years and they do great work. The prices were better than anyone around and work was done right. Don’t be ripped off by the other guys call Kenny Robbins Transmission you will be glad you did!

name: Enrico Licciardello
text:
The prices are good
The work is good and great quality service very clean inside and out and Kenny is the best and Kenny Robbins Transmission is the best

name: Steve Cole
text: I was having problems with my 2014 F-150 4X4 transmission shuddering and slipping. I checked around and heard about Kenny. His price beat the other shops around so I decided to give him a try. 6 months down the road and many miles not the first problem. I am very satisfied. He even called to check if i was happy ! Thanks

name: Kimberly Cole Zemke
text: Five thousand happy customers and then this man comes along!!!  We have bent over backward for Mr. Linda Norris but this man cannot be pleased!  We have put a free axle on his vehicle and we have done free electrical work and this gentleman was asked to take his vehicle to the Honda place for the engine codes and he refused.  This man has threatened our shop on numerous occasions with attorneys and sheriffs.  No one wants to be threatened after they have bent over backwards for a customer and gave them free work and free parts.  He simply bought a lemon vehicle and wants to take it out on our shop and now he wants us to give him his money back on the transmission job when the transmission is shifting perfectly and doing exactly what the transmission should do when running at optimum levels.  I have two videos in excess of twenty five minutes of the vehicle running perfectly just today May 18th 2016.  Some people you just cannot please.  Mr. Norris has changed his review again and again trying to extort us to give his money back.  Here is the original review in its entirety that Mr. Norris wrote on our shop after we did a splendid job on his transmission and this is what he wrote:  Kenny Robbins is the best mechanic in the area.  He worked hard to make sure my son's car was mechanically fit to send him off to college.  His shop is open 7 days a week and they work long hours.  I would definitely recommend his shop for repairs.  If you have problems he is the best mechanic in the area and his prices are fair.  He is honest and doesn't try to sell you parts you don't need like some shops will.  You will definitely be satisfied with the service from his shop and his family!!!  I can't thank them enough!

name: R Agee
text: Kenny Robbins Transmissions rebuilt the transmission in my 2002 Chevrolet Silverado and recently my 2008 Ford Ranger. He did a great job with a warranty to back it up. I will do business with him in the future if needed. Thank you Kenny and team.

name: Craig Lockhart
text: Kenny rebuilt the transmission in my Land Rover recently and he did an amazing job! I drive it hard on and off road and it is rock solid! Kenny also pointed out some other problems, that l was not aware of, that could have caused me problems in the future. Thank you Kenny, awesome job!

name: Houston Wilson
text: Very well respected company with great customer service and a outstanding job done within a reasonably mannered time. Will definitely repeat business with these guys.

name: Amber Huett
text: Kimberly noticed that my brakes were grinding and making a loud noise.  I have a young son and she was worried about us.  She told me I needed my brakes done but I am in between jobs so my Dad bought the brakes and she had Kenny put them on for free.  They are very good people and Kenny is the best and hardest working mechanic out there.  If you need Transmission work or small jobs done on your vehicle Kenny is your man.  I would highly recommend them.  It is a family owned business.

name: Kimberly Powell
text:
The reason for the 2 stars is, My husband dropped off a transmission, Mr Robbins was not there a nice young man said he was in Pville shopping but leave it right here beside the desk . 2 1/2 months later I/my husband checked on and picked it up untouched still on the floor right beside the desk where it was left sitting . So no He didn't have a record of doing any work for us. He didn't do nothing (to our transmission) for 2 months. So while I cannot say he does good or bad work. So no work is not good either.
. (Part 2) This is Mike, I have a question? How do you go from I have no record of you and we haven't done anything, To full knowledge of everything including the price stipulations that I put on the repair? I am not broke. But there is a set value for this vehicle. I am not going to over invest in a cheap truck. Yes I dropped it off, yes I set a price that I was willing to spend on it. I can buy one for that with free shipping on ebay. Or from Shorty on 22. The truck in question was not something I was restoring . It was for sale. You don't spend a lot on vehicles you are selling. You do however have to repair them. A phone call would have been great. The only thing that was wrong with it was a sheared roll pin. It cost me about $2.00. I think $398.00 would have been fair pay to install a $2.00 pin. I did it myself. PS I changed it to 3 stars Happy? Who said I need charity? I needed a phone call so I would know to go a different direction. That was the part you guys failed on. It is ok you didn't want to do the job. I did leave my number with the young man I left the transmission with. I asked him to call when ready or if there was any problem. I would say that your business not being willing to do the work counts as a problem, wouldn't you? PS I have a pretty good lawyer as well. I have been sued before. I have him on speed dial. If you have a problem with honesty, It is your problem. Do your worst. This isn't spite, it is honesty.  And I don't have a problem with you are your company. -Mike

resp.text:
Ms. Powell this is Kimberly the office manager for Kenny Robbin's Transmissions.  I cannot find any records of having done any transmission repair work for you.  Can you please give us a call and tell us if we actually did any work for you or if it was done at another shop.  Give me a call please at 334-875-3594 because we do not want you to be an unhappy customer.  We stand behind all of our work and we aim to be the best.  Thank you and God Bless You

I know who you are Ms. Powell and what you are saying is completely incorrect!
What your husband said was if it was going to cost over FOUR HUNDRED DOLLARS to fix that standard shift transmission then do not touch it and he would come back and pick it up.  THEREFORE MAAM it was left untouched!!!  If you do not have the money to have your transmission worked on then why did you bring it in the first place you should not have wasted our time and yours bringing it here!    We are a business not a charity.  You gave us a bad review out of meanness and spite.  It is not our responsibility to do free jobs for you and your husband.  Thank you and have a wonderful life!!  You need to take that review down and move on or I will consult with an attorney because we did as asked!  Nothing more nothing less!

name: Matt Kimberly
text: Kimberly is very friendly and goes out of her way to go the second mile with her customers!

text: They were amazing. They were very quick on turnaround. They never left me waiting to know what was going on with my vehicle. They are a very trustworthy business and not out to gouge their customers

text: They did great work on my mustang, been a few years and still going strong. Came highly recommend from coworkers and friends. They may be a little busy but that's just cause they're the best in town.
